DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Erythema Severity Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the severity of red discoloration of the skin caused by infectious agents, inflammation, drug hypersensitivity, or underlying disease using a 4-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Erythema Severity Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue._Red discoloration of the skin caused by infectious agents, inflammation, drug hypersensitivity, or underlying disease._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
